channel.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
channel.description:
Hey there guys, I was recently informed that private servers are what they are hyped up to be :) I didnt know you could add stuff etc etc.... Now My question is, where would I go about learning how to start writing my own source? Thanks.
PS: Give me all the info you got !

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @boomer216 boomer216
item.description:
@boomer216 wrote:

Javac answered you question perfectly, go ahead and do it!

Read full topic
item.source: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Avaphi Avaphi
item.description:
@Avaphi wrote:

[quote=“double helix, post:22, topic:51789”]Ok… you will have to make it so moparscape (or another client) can connect to it. So you will have to have an existing code next to you.

The thing you have to do is make a server class, this is your main class and will loop all the commands. Then you have to make a class that the client will call. Its a lot of work before you will get anything, and i wouldnt suggest it. Just look verry good at existing codes.

}{}{[/quote]
This is the best response so far, thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Mopar_Helper Mopar Helper
item.description:
@Mopar_Helper wrote:

Download hybridscape and remove all of the source then start? (or testscape) but you will need the client…

Read full topic

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @double_helix double helix
item.description:
@double_helix wrote:

Ok… you will have to make it so moparscape (or another client) can connect to it. So you will have to have an existing code next to you.

The thing you have to do is make a server class, this is your main class and will loop all the commands. Then you have to make a class that the client will call. Its a lot of work before you will get anything, and i wouldnt suggest it. Just look verry good at existing codes.

}{}{

Read full topic

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @wooker wooker
item.description:
@wooker wrote:

[quote=“Avaphi, post:16, topic:51789”]Wow… This is by far some of the dumbest responses I have ever heard… I thought this forum was to help people out, but all I hear is “Do it yourself blah blah”. Thanks anyways ?[/quote]You said your good at java… Why are you asking for help then? Also stop being so ungrateful. You asked for help, People give it, and you tell them their stupid. Why don’t YOU grow a brain and make a server “from scratch” Yourself. Javac already posted what you need to start from scratch. Have fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:14, topic:51789”][quote author=Avaphi link=topic=72720.msg823845#msg823845 date=1169810108]
… Please stop clogging my topic? I want to know how to start from literal scratch… NOTHING. -.-
[/quote]
Javac has actually been nice and given you a little more then nothing - But I’ll give you my own very highly regarded advice. To start a source from scratch, and this is assuming you’re a Windows user, click ‘Start’, ‘All Programs’, ‘Accessories’, and then select Notepad.

Use your brain. If you claim to be good at Java then you should know how to start a new class.[/quote]
Nicely said =\

Read full topic
item.source: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Avaphi:

… Please stop clogging my topic? I want to know how to start from literal scratch… NOTHING. -.-

Javac has actually been nice and given you a little more then nothing - But I’ll give you my own very highly regarded advice. To start a source from scratch, and this is assuming you’re a Windows user, click ‘Start’, ‘All Programs’, ‘Accessories’, and then select Notepad.

Use your brain. If you claim to be good at Java then you should know how to start a new class.

Read full topic

item.title: Writing A Source- Starting From Scratch! Help Please
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Go to the download section, Find a source that suits you.
From there edit it with shops…mini games…quest…t trails… things like that
And. if you can… MAKE IT DIFFERENT FROM OTHER SERVERS…
There all the same nowadays…
Make it origional… new… FLASHY! lol
